sentence.Network_en: He favoured a middle course between free enterprise and state intervention.
sentence.Network_cn: 他更倾向于在自由经营与国家干预之间走一条中庸之道。

sentence.Network_en: History may judge the enterprise to have been rather backward-looking.
sentence.Network_cn: 历史也许会证明这一雄心勃勃的计划过于保守了。

sentence.Network_en: It seemed a singularly ill-judged enterprise for Truman to undertake.
sentence.Network_cn: 这对于杜鲁门来说似乎是一项特别不明智的事业。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, something undertaken', feminine past participle (used as a noun) of entreprendre, based on Latin prendere, prehendere 'to take'

entry.def: An enterprise is a company or business, often a small one.

example.ex: There are plenty of small industrial enterprises.

entry.tran: （新的、困难的或重要的）事业，项目
entry.def: An enterprise is something new, difficult, or important that you do or try to do.

example.ex: ...the first Director of such a novel enterprise...
example.tran: 这样一个全新项目的第一任主管

example.ex: Horse breeding is indeed a risky enterprise.
example.tran: 养马确实是个有风险的营生。

entry.def: Enterprise is the activity of managing companies and businesses and starting new ones.

example.ex: He is still involved in voluntary work promoting local enterprise.
example.tran: 他仍在从事促进当地创业的志愿者工作。

example.ex: ...a national program of subsidies to private enterprise.
example.tran: 国家个人创业补贴计划

entry.tran: 进取心;事业心;创业精神
entry.def: Enterprise is the ability to think of new and effective things to do, together with an eagerness to do them.

example.ex: ...the spirit of enterprise worthy of a free and industrious people.
example.tran: 自由勤劳的民族具有的进取精神
那个团队事业心的缺乏

means.word_mean: 1. a purposeful or industrious undertaking (especially one that requires effort or boldness);

sentences.sentence: "he had doubts about the whole enterprise"

means.word_mean: 2. an organization created for business ventures;

sentences.sentence: "a growing enterprise must have a bold leader"

means.word_mean: 3. readiness to embark on bold new ventures

auth_sentence.content: At the heart of free enterprise is good education.
auth_sentence.res_content: At the heart of free enterprise is good education.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: At the heart of free enterprise is good education.

auth_sentence.content: Swiss enterprise has begun to penetrate these retired valleys.
auth_sentence.res_content: Swiss enterprise has begun to penetrate these retired valleys.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Swiss enterprise has begun to penetrate these retired valleys.

auth_sentence.content: We trust unregulated private enterprise only at our peril.
auth_sentence.res_content: We trust unregulated private enterprise only at our peril.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We trust unregulated private enterprise only at our peril.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有进取心的,有事业心的
stems_affixes.word_buile: enterprise事业心,进取心+ing……的→adj.有进取心的,有事业心的
surprise诧异,惊异+ing状态→adj.令人惊讶的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 事业,企[事]业单位;事业心,进取心
stems_affixes.word_buile: enter进入+prise拿住,抓住→进入抓住[目标]→把某一事业掌握一定范围→企业;事业
sur在……上面+prise拿住,抓住→在上面突然被抓住→吃惊
ap加强动作+prise拿住,抓住→抓住信息

stems_affixes.value_cn: 包含,包括,由……组成;构成,组成
stems_affixes.word_buile: com全部+prise拿住,抓住→全部抓住→包括
sur在……上面+prise拿住,抓住→在上面突然被抓住→吃惊

Sentence.sentence: Piling on higher taxes won't help, "If higher taxes make it more expensive to raise children," says Nicholas Eberstadt of the American Enterprise Institute, "people will think twice about having another child.

sentences.en: They are determined to carry forward the enterprise.
sentences.cn: 他们决心把事业进行下去。

sentences.en: He is a man of great enterprise.

jushi.english: He is a man of great enterprise.
jushi.chinese: 他是个很有进取心的人。

jushi.chinese: 开创这个企业的是他的伯父。
